title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15ยง 1.4 - Operation to and from a place of business
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15ยง 1.4 - Operation to and from a place of business

State Regulations
(a) Regularly scheduled basis shall mean
employment by an employer or employers on a recurring basis. (b) Nassau and Suffolk Counties: A licensee
who is employed on a regularly scheduled basis as set forth in subdivision (a)
of this section may drive unaccompanied to and from a place of business as set
forth in section
1.1
(a) of this

Part provided such licensee has been issued a "Certificate of Employment" (form
MV-58A) completed by the licensee's employer. (c) In all other areas of the State, except
the City of New York and the Counties of Nassau and Suffolk: A licensee who is
employed on a regularly scheduled basis as set forth in subdivision (a) of this
section may drive unaccompanied to and from a place of business as set forth in
section
1.1
(a) of this

Part provided such licensee possesses his or her driver's license and either
the "Certificate of Employment" (form MV-58A) completed by such licensee's
employer, a letter signed by his or her employer containing the date of the
letter, the licensee's name, the motorist identification number and job
description, the date or days of licensee's employment, the hours of
employment, the location or locations of employment and the phone number, as
well as the address at which the employer may be contacted by a police officer
or magistrate for verification. Suggested forms of letters are set forth below: January 1, 1990

To Whom It May Concern: John R. Robert driver license identification number R15070
19146 312544-74 is employed by X Shipping Company as a dispatch clerk. Mr. Robert works every Monday and Tuesday night from 7:00 p.m. to 10:30 p.m. at 105

Brent Street, Hudson, New York. I will verify the specific times of Mr. Robert's employment
on Monday and Tuesday nights when contacted by a police officer or magistrate. I may be contacted at 3 Brookwood Drive, Hudson, New York at 555-3415. Yours, Joseph E. Proprietor (Signature)
X Shipping Company Manager

January 1, 1990

To Whom It May Concern: Joan R. Robert Driver License I.D. # ________ is employed
by Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Shore as a babysitter. Ms. Robert works at least one
evening a week, and her hours of employment vary from week to week. Ms. Robert
works at the Shore home, Building 1, Apt. 14, Roseview Court, Hudson, New

York. I will verify the specific times Ms. Robert worked for me
if contacted by a police officer or magistrate at the above address, or by
phone at 555-3255. Sincerely, Joseph Shore (Signature)
(d) The provision of the Vehicle and Traffic

Law which permits a class DJ or class MJ licensee to drive to and from his or
her place of employment between 9 p.m. and 5 a.m. does not permit such licensee
to drive a motor vehicle in the course of such employer's business (e.g., delivery boy/girl) during those hours, except for farm employment
purposes. Notes
